Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder of a pale red-brown pottery vessel, with cylindrical and ribbed sides, drawn in towards mouth, the fabric is grey in section, the interior is partly covered with a resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394115) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394115)
